page.title: 09Transport to Herm.
page.content: The only way to reach Herm is by boat. In summer, three companies run between St. Peter Port and Herm. The 3 mile journey takes between 15 minutes and half an hour, depending on the type of launch. They can carry up to 2,000 passengers on a busy summer day. They start their service early in the morning with the "milk" run, allowing day visitors over 8 hours on the island. In winter only one company, Travel Trident operates, running a daily boat taking workers to Herm in the morning and returning with the milk for the Guernsey dairy, and taking workers home again in the late afternoon. The Travel Trident boats also carry all the cargo and daily supplies needed by the island.
